Key Match Events: The Celtics made 29 of 61 three-pointers in the game.
The Knicks shot 55 percent from the field but were still blown out.
The Celtics spent the last six minutes of the game missing 13-straight threes trying to break the single-game record.
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks acquired Mikal Bridges and Karl-Anthony Towns in the offseason to challenge the Celtics.
The Knicks emphasized size, shooting, and defensive switchability as their strategy.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks need to shoot more threes and get to the free-throw line to compete with the Celtics.
The Knicks have a schematic route to victory by denying shooters airspace and trusting their wing defenders.
